contentrichtext.text: {{Cleanup|date=November 2009}} :For the brothers in the epic [[Ramayana]], see [[Rama]] and [[Laxman]].'' '''Raamlaxman''' (born '''Vijay Patil''') Marathi(राम लक्ष्मण )is an [[India]]n [[piano|pianist]] and [[accordion]]ist and was part of an orchestra called the Amar - Vijay Orchestra. Vijay Patil paired with Raam. He is the "Laxman" of duo composers "Raam-Laxman". "Raam" is well known marathi music director "Ram Kadam" "Raam" died right after signing for Agent Vinod (1977) in 1976. Vijay Patil however continued with the name, as he had great success in '90s with Maine Pyar Kiya (1989), changed the spelling to "Raamlaxman". He has composed several hit songs in Hindi and Marathi. Raamlaxman has made almost 75 films in [[Hindi]], [[Marathi language|Marathi]] and [[Bhojpuri]]. Raamlaxman is most famous for his work with Rajshri Productions of Hindi films. He composed music for their hit films like ''[[Maine Pyar Kiya]]'', ''[[Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!]]'', ''[[Hum Saath Saath Hain]]'' and others. His first film with the production house was ''Agent Vinod''. ==See also== *[[List of Bollywood films]] ==External links== * {{IMDb name | id=1601855 | name = Vijay Patil (Laxman) }} {{FilmfareAwardBestMusicDirector}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Laxman, Raam | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Laxman, Raam}} [[Category:Indian film score composers]] [[Category:Filmfare Awards winners]] [[Category:Marathi people]] [[Category:Indian Hindus]] [[Category:Living people]] {{India-musician-stub}}
